intro: Dissochaeta intermedia, commonly known as the slender false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring upright, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by oval, ribbed fruits that are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are lance-shaped, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. Dissochaeta intermedia is adapted to well-drained soils and thrives in open, sunny habitats.
